text.section: A person who has violated KRS 434.590 shall be guilty of a Class A misdemeanor.
A person who has violated KRS 434.600 shall be guilty of a Class D felony.
A person who has violated the provisions of KRS 434.675(1) shall be guilty of a Class D felony for the first offense and a Class C felony for each subsequent offense.
A person who has violated the provisions of KRS 434.675(2) shall be guilty of a Class D felony for the first offense and a Class C felony for each subsequent offense.

law.history: Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 27, sec. 3, effective July 13, 2004. -- Amended 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 463, sec. 60, effective July 14, 1992. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 331, sec. 53, effective July 15, 1986. -- Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 83, sec. 18.
